remarks.para: May be inoperative provided approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: With an inoperative Thrust Management Computer, consider the following:

numlitem.para: Thrust reference mode (TO, CLB, etc) will not be available.
Use manual thrust reference selector (located on EICAS control panel) to set takeoff, climb and Go-Around thrust.
Use a rated thrust for takeoff.
EGT amber indications which are normally inhibited during takeoff or Go-Arounds will be operative.
The SPD Flag may remain in view on the ADI Ref B757 DDG.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.

placard.para: Placard Autothrottle Arming Switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: For Thrust Management Computer inoperative, including when it is (stuck) in the initialization loop (flashing displays), open and collar the three TMC circuit breakers: AC (F14), DC (F15) and Servo (F16) on the P11 panel.
Set Autothrottle Arm switch to OFF.
